column4: I installed a 686 linux image via, but when I reboot and do a uname -r, I am still using the generic. How do I get Ubuntu to use the linux-image-686?
and what kernel did you installed ?
686, as the machine is a p3.
yes but the exact kernel name ? linux-image-2.6????
I got it from apt. How am I to know?
It's linux-image-686, which I mentioned above.
hum, you use dapper isn't it ?
On Eft, actually. Perhaps that's it.
I don't use this one I'm on dapper sorry
